intro: Diasperus rufoglaucus, commonly known as the red-veined sand thorn, is a shrub native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, narrow leaves with a distinctive reddish underside. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by small, fleshy fruits that are edible when ripe. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions with deep roots and a waxy leaf coating to reduce water loss. Diasperus rufoglaucus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
